title: is overly optimistic about directly applying his Tit for Tat solution to n-person games
I owe this point to Miller and Drexler
who stresses the technological form of predications with the concept of social engineering. This suggests another contrast: Artificial Morality is individual engineering
An elementary but instructive example of this is Furguson
which partially implements Asimov’s Three Laws of Robotics in Prolog. Asimov’s work shows how quickly one reaches deep problems with this small set of rules

Do I—a partially retreaded philosopher—claim to understand Gauthier’s theory so well? No. I probably distort morals by agreement, ignoring some of its humane content in my efforts to bend it towards Artificial Morality
